tasks.title: Card Generation from Notebook Blocks
tasks.description: Select text in NotebookBlock → AI suggests cards with format intelligence and card-worthiness feedback → user confirms → card created with provenance. Post-creation: blocks with cards show muted visual indicator.
tasks.details:
CORE PHILOSOPHY:
The Notebook is the 'What Boards Test' registry—curated, clinically-relevant content. Card generation treats text selection as a conversation starter with AI, not a binding specification. User identifies what confuses them; AI becomes collaborative tutor evaluating whether confusion merits a flashcard.

INTERACTION FLOW:
1. HOVER & SELECT:
- Hover over text in NotebookBlock shows subtle highlight
- Click activates selection mode with context-aware bounding box (expands to semantic units: sentences, clinical facts, procedural steps)
- Floating 'Generate Card' button anchors to selection
- Click-to-activate prevents accidental triggers

2. AI CONTEXT STRATEGY:
- Full NotebookBlock content as context (prevents 'lost in the middle')
- Highlighted portion marked with semantic emphasis
- Optional 'Why do you want to learn this?' text field (teaching moment + format hint)
- If user writes 'I keep confusing X with Y' → AI suggests discriminative format

3. FORMAT INTELLIGENCE:
AI auto-suggests one of five formats with visual explanation:
- Clinical Vignette Q&A: diagnostic reasoning
- Overlapping Cloze: lists that risk sibling contamination
- Single-Fact Cloze: discrete knowledge
- Image Occlusion: when images referenced
- Procedural Sequential: step-based skills
Format shown as labeled dropdown, default is AI suggestion, instant override available.

4. CARD-WORTHINESS SOFT-GATE (integrated, not separate F6):
- Quality panel shows 3 traffic lights: Testable? One Concept? Discriminative?
- Yellow/red indicators have expandable explanation panel
- Options: [Edit First] [Create Anyway] (tracked) [Skip]
- Teaches effective card design through use, not blocking

5. PROCEDURAL CARDS (MVP):
- AI detects procedural content (keywords: steps, procedure, technique, how to)
- Generates two-part card: Front=supplies checklist (pre-revealed), Back=numbered steps
- Uses standard card template; voice-activated equipment reveal deferred (see DEFERRED: Procedural Simulation Mode)

6. CARD CREATION:
- Card saved with: notebookTopicPageId, sourceBlockId, tags from topic, FSRS defaults
- Toast: 'Card created' with [View] link
- NotebookBlock shows muted visual indicator (subtle box around text) showing content has been turned into card(s)
- Indicator is non-distracting (muted colors, optional hover to reveal)

7. USER TEACHING MOMENTS:
- When user creates basic list card, card-worthiness flags it
- AI offers auto-generate improved versions (overlapping cloze, individual vignettes)

PERFORMANCE TARGET:
- Text selection to created card: <20 seconds including AI processing
- Optimistic UI: AI thinking indicator immediately, streaming preview updates, editable fields before AI completes
- Database writes async after Create click, local state updates first

COMPONENTS:
- src/components/notebook/CardGenerationModal.tsx
- src/components/notebook/CardSuggestionPreview.tsx
- src/components/notebook/FormatSelector.tsx
- src/components/notebook/CardWorthinessPanel.tsx
- Update NotebookBlock.tsx: Add selection handling + card indicator styling

AI FUNCTIONS in electron/ai-service.ts:
- generateCardFromBlock(blockContent: string, topicContext: string, userIntent?: string): Promise<CardSuggestion[]>
- evaluateCardWorthiness(cardContent: string): Promise<WorthinessResult>

subtasks.description: Create CardWorthinessPanel.tsx with compact traffic-light strip showing 3 criteria. Each criterion has green/yellow/red indicator with expandable explanation. Track [Create Anyway] clicks for analytics.
subtasks.details:
THREE CRITERIA:

1. TESTABLE - Has one clear correct answer; survives rephrasing
   Pass: 'What marker rises first in MI?' → Troponin
   Fail: 'Describe MI pathophysiology' (essay, no single answer)

2. ONE CONCEPT - Tests exactly one retrievable fact
   Pass: 'Door-to-balloon target?' → <90 min
   Fail: 'Name 5 STEMI criteria' (list = multiple facts)

3. DISCRIMINATIVE - Distinguishes from similar concepts
   Pass: 'Troponin vs CK-MB timing?' (forces comparison)
   Fail: 'What's a cardiac marker?' (too generic, no discrimination)

UI: Compact traffic-light strip (horizontal row of 3 circles). Hover/click on indicator → expands explanation panel with pass/fail examples. Yellow = borderline, Red = clear violation. Teaching moment: when red, suggest alternative format (e.g., 'Consider overlapping cloze for lists').
subtasks.testStrategy: Test with: (1) 'Name 5 causes of chest pain' → One Concept should be red, (2) 'Describe pathophysiology of MI' → Testable should be red, (3) 'What is a troponin?' → Discriminative should be yellow, (4) 'Troponin rises before CK-MB. True/False?' → All green.

tasks.title: Browser Capture Hook: local HTTP API for Tampermonkey integration
tasks.description: Expose local HTTP endpoint in Electron main process for browser scripts to send captured content directly to Knowledge Bank.
tasks.details:
HTTP API SERVER:
1. Start Express/http server on localhost:PORT (configurable, default 23847)
2. Endpoint: POST /capture
   - Body: { content: string, title?: string, sourceType: 'qbank'|'article'|'web', url?: string, imageBase64?: string }
   - Returns: { success: boolean, sourceItemId?: string, error?: string }
3. Security: localhost only, optional API key in header
4. On receive: Create SourceItem in inbox, trigger refreshSmartViewCounts
5. Settings UI: Enable/disable HTTP capture, show port, regenerate API key

TAMPERMONKEY INTEGRATION:
- User installs script that adds 'Send to DougHub' button on PeerPrep/MKSAP pages
- Script extracts question HTML, sends to localhost endpoint
- DougHub shows toast 'Captured from PeerPrep'

Note: User has existing script to adapt.
tasks.testStrategy: Start app, verify HTTP server running. POST to /capture with test content, verify SourceItem created in inbox. Test from Tampermonkey script on actual qbank site.

tasks.title: Basic Learning Mode: post-review mistakes summary with elaborated feedback
tasks.description: After review session, show 'Review Mistakes?' prompt displaying missed cards with AI-generated why-wrong explanations.
tasks.details:
LEARNING MODE ENTRY:
1. After review session ends (no more due cards or user exits):
   - If mistakes > 0: Show modal 'Review X mistakes?'
   - [Review Now] / [Skip]
2. Mistakes Review UI:
   - Vertical scroll through each mistake
   - Show: Card front, your timing/grade, correct answer
   - AI elaborated feedback: 'Why this is wrong: ...'
   - 'Why correct answer is right: ...'
   - Related concept hints
3. AI Function: generateElaboratedFeedback(card, userResponse)
   - Uses card content + topic context
   - Returns { whyWrong: string, whyRight: string, relatedConcepts: string[] }
4. End of mistakes: 'All reviewed!' with summary stats

This is the highest-yield learning pipeline feature. Other learning mode features (T94-T107) remain in DEFERRED.md for future implementation.
tasks.testStrategy: Complete review session with 2+ mistakes. Verify prompt appears. Click Review Now, verify mistakes display with AI feedback. Verify all mistakes can be scrolled through.

tasks.title: Two-Mode Capture: FAB modal with auto-classification and Process Now button
tasks.description: Expand capture modal with content auto-classification, AI title generation, and disabled 'Process Now' button (enabled after T117 Learning Mode).
tasks.details:
TWO-MODE CAPTURE PRINCIPLE:

1. SINGLE CAPTURE MODAL (QuickDumpModal expansion):
- Opened via FAB (+), global shortcut, drag-drop, or Tampermonkey prefill
- Plaintext textarea with auto-detect: Text / URL / PDF / Image / QBank
- AI auto-title (debounced, editable, fallback to truncation)

2. TWO EXITS:
- [Save to Inbox] (primary): Create SourceItem, close modal, show toast
- [Process Now] (secondary, disabled initially): Create SourceItem, enter guided processing

3. AUTO-CLASSIFICATION:
- Detect content type from paste/drop
- Show badge indicating detected type
- Set sourceType field automatically

4. PROCESS NOW BUTTON:
- Initially disabled with tooltip 'Coming soon - complete Learning Mode first'
- Enabled after T117 (Learning Mode) is complete
- When enabled: saves to inbox then navigates to guided processing flow

NOTE: This expands T38's basic capture with the two-mode principle. Inbox remains derived view (status='inbox').
